value.name: Robert D. Brown Jr. Named Duncanville Assistant City Manager
value.description: Robert D. Brown Jr., longtime Duncanville Police Chief, named their Assistant City Manager, overseeing Police, Fire, and other departments.

value.name: Niagara hoops keeping the band together
value.description: During an offseason in which over 1,600 Division I players entered the transfer portal — an average of close to five per team — Niagara University men's basketball expects to return all but two scholarship players this fall,

value.name: Law enforcement visit Omaha barbershop to talk about public safety
value.description: Haircuts and discussions. Those are two things that took place Saturday at the Blendz Barbering Co., where local law enforcement had a seminar with the community about “dos and don’ts” during a traffic stop.

value.name: Shootout in Parkway Village involved at least 8 people, Memphis police say

value.name: 'Rome wasn't built in a day.' Officers, public seek to bridge gap
value.description: "Rome wasn't built overnight," Michael Graham said. "So it's going to take some time, but I just appreciate the officers as well as the people coming out to try and take the steps to figuring out what we've got to do to fix that gap.

value.name: Honor Park ceremony honors all those who serve through a special tribute
value.description: The ceremony recognized the Army, Navy, Marines, Air Force, Police, Fire Dept., EMTs, teachers and citizens. In an event at Fort Oglethorpe's Honor Park on Saturday, people honored all those who have or currently serve.

value.description: Robert Brown, 62, of Hall Gardens, Gateshead, was charged with conspiracy to supply heroin, possession with intent to supply heroin, possession with intent to supply cocaine and money laundering.

value.name: Dealer who claimed he turned to crime while on furlough found with drugs and cash in his socks
value.description: A heroin and crack-cocaine dealer was caught with a stash of drugs and money hidden in his socks, a court heard. Richard Capell turned to crime when he was laid off work without being furloughed during the Covid-19 outbreak.

value.description: A PAEDOPHILE sexually abused a young girl leaving her feeling sick and unable to trust adult men, a court heard.

value.name: 'Fast-moving fire': Four families displaced in early morning fire in Dennis
value.description: A two-alarm fire at a condominium building on Union Wharf Road displaced four families early Tuesday morning. Firefighters received a report of a "fast-moving fire" at 75 Union Wharf Road at 12:26 a.m.
